text: Cristine Prosperi (born ) is a Canadian actress. She is known for portraying Imogen Moreno on Degrassi, Tiara Turner on the Family Channel series Really Me, and Mikayla in the TeenNick series Open Heart. ==Career== Prosperi was born in Toronto and debuted when she was three in an advertisement for Unico. Already singer and dancer, she began her acting career with small roles in the 2007 movies Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming and Your Beautiful Cul de Sac Home. In 2009 she guest starred on the comedy series The Latest Buzz. In 2011, Prosperi was cast in one of her better-known roles, that of Imogen Moreno on the television teen drama Degrassi, a role she began playing during the show's eleventh season. She remained on Degrassi through the series finale at the end of the show's fourteenth season in 2015. Thanks to this role, she won the Best Performance in a TV Series - Leading Young Actress Award at Young Artist Awards in 2012, as well as winning a large fan following on Twitter and Instagram, and a general consensus for giving voice to the LGBT community. Prosperi also starred in the 2012 web series Totally Amp'd as Aria and in the 2013 Nickelodeon television movie Nicky Deuce. In 2015, she appeared in the TeenNick series Open Heart, where she played the role of the bright and gossipy Mikayla Walker. In 2016 she starred in the Lifetime movie His Double Life. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Film and television roles |- ! Year ! Title !
